text: Abu Borhan Mohammad Badruzzaman is a professor of Civil Engineering at the Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET). He is currently serving as the Vice-Chancellor (VC) of BUET. The Government of Bangladesh appointed him to this position in 2024 for a four-year term. == Early life and education == Dr. Badruzzaman has an extensive academic background in civil and environmental engineering. His education includes: * Ph.D. in Civil Engineering (Environment) from the University of Virginia, USA, in 1992. * Master of Science in Civil Engineering (Environment) from BUET, Dhaka, Bangladesh, in 1987. * Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering from BUET, Dhaka, Bangladesh, in 1984. == Research and achievements == Dr. Badruzzaman has made notable contributions to research in the field of environmental engineering, particularly in groundwater contamination and water treatment. His work has earned him several prestigious awards and recognitions. == Awards and recognition == * ITEX Gold Medal 2019: Dr. Badruzzaman received this award from the Malaysian Invention and Design Society (MINDS) for his invention called "NB-Care: A Universal Platform for Vertical Application." This award was given during the 30th International Technology Invention, Innovation, and Exhibition in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. * Prince Sultan Bin Abdulaziz Prize for Water 2012: Dr. Badruzzaman, along with Dr. Charles Franklin Harvey from MIT, was awarded this prize for their research on arsenic contamination in groundwater in Bangladesh. Their work developed a complete model for understanding and preventing this contamination. * Most Cited Paper Award: One of Dr. Badruzzaman’s research papers titled “Solid-phases and desorption processes of arsenic within Bangladesh sediments,” published in Chemical Geology, was recognized as the most cited paper from 2005 to 2010. * Chi Epsilon Best Student in Civil Engineering: Dr. Badruzzaman was recognized as the top civil engineering graduate student in 1991 during his studies. ==References== Category:Bangladeshi academics
title: Abu Borhan Mohammad Badruzzaman
